Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery skyphos; interior: top of rim reserved, glazed below; exterior: two black lines at rim; below, to left, female figure’s hand, (only traces of added white remaining); at right, part of head and shoulder of bearded male figure facing right with incised fillet, stippled all over.
Curator's comments: The sherd is contemporary with the Komast group. The male figure may be a satyr with human ears (Beazley and Payne 1929, 259).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.39)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 259, no. 19)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 361, no. B470)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 229, no. 30)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0341) (Phase 1)
